t: To the chief Musician on Neginoth upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David.
O*p Lord,*s rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
Have*p mercy upon me, O Lord;*s for I am weak: O Lord,*s heal me; for my bones are vexed.
My*p soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O Lord,*s how long?
Return,*p O Lord,*s deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies' sake.
For*p in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?
I*p am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.
Mine*p eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.
Depart*p from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the Lord*s hath heard the voice of my weeping.
The*p Lord*s hath heard my supplication; the Lord*s will receive my prayer.
Let*p all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.
